ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Bard sit in scheduled
ygData.msgSnippet: The broken as intended message from VI on Lullaby was the proverbial straw.  When El Gordo made the comment that it should *ALWAYS* have a base resist (on
ygData.messageBody:
The "broken as intended" message from VI on Lullaby was the proverbial
straw. When El Gordo made the comment that it should *ALWAYS* have a base
resist (on the 2nd resist) no matter the PC/MOB level difference, then
called that balanced vs no mana usage... well, that was the point where most
folks had had enough. (not to mention the never-before-heard-of "Lullaby was
never supposed to work on creatures over level 30" I've been in EQ since
Beta, followed bard news VERY closely, and have never heard that before.
Ever.)


-=B=-
Currently dressed up as a lil' Necro
The Rathe
> What exactly prompted this strike? I mean, I know about all (or very
> nearly all) the nerfs we've gotten. So I'm not looking for a full
detailed
> history beginning in beta 2 or anything like that. I'm just wondering
what
> the last straw was. I think I missed that while I was away from EQ and
> this list for about a month.
>
> Thanks.
>
> Evulia, who hasn't gotten out in almost 2 months simply because I've been
> having more fun with the rogue, Tunare
>
>
>
>
> Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
>
